headline: Amazon, Microsoft back effort to curb Nvidia's exports to China, WSJ reports
summary: Short for Guaranteeing Access and Innovation for National Artificial Intelligence (GAIN), the Act was introduced as part of the National Defense Authorization Act and ⁠stipulates that AI chipmakers prioritize ‌domestic orders for advanced processors before supplying them to foreign customers.  Microsoft publicly came out in favor of the legislation,‍ while officials at Amazon's cloud unit have privately told Senate staffers that they also support it, the report said.  Meta Platforms and Alphabet's Google have ​not taken a position on the Act, and neither has U.‌S. President Donald Trump, the report added.

content.title: Amazon, Microsoft back effort to curb Nvidia's exports to China, WSJ reports
content.summary: Short for Guaranteeing Access and Innovation for National Artificial Intelligence (GAIN), the Act was introduced as part of the National Defense Authorization Act and ⁠stipulates that AI chipmakers prioritize ‌domestic orders for advanced processors before supplying them to foreign customers.  Microsoft publicly came out in favor of the legislation,‍ while officials at Amazon's cloud unit have privately told Senate staffers that they also support it, the report said.  Meta Platforms and Alphabet's Google have ​not taken a position on the Act, and neither has U.‌S. President Donald Trump, the report added.

headline: Reliance to set up 1 gigawatt AI data centre in India's Andhra Pradesh
summary: Reliance Industries plans to set up a 1-gigawatt AI data center in ​India's Andhra Pradesh, the state's chief minister ‌said on Friday, adding to infrastructure capacity in India where the likes ‌of Google and Microsoft have made huge AI investments. headline: 'You Do Want A Bubble,' Says Groq CEO Jonathan Ross On AI Frenzy — Insists The Money Will Be 'Returned With Interest' Despite Fears Of A Crash
summary: The surge of money into artificial intelligence is a sign of activity, not a warning sign of collapse, according to Groq CEO Jonathan Ross. Bubble Or Boom Ross told CNBC last month that rising investment reflects competition among companies racing to build better AI systems. headline: Oracle Stock Set to Drop for Fourth Day. How Its OpenAI Bet Went Wrong for the Shares.
summary: Oracle  stock has given back all the gains from the cloud computing group’s “  Nvidia  Moment” as investors grow increasingly cautious over investments linked to the artificial intelligence boom.  The selloff is due, in part, to the stock having risen so sharply over the month that followed its update, as news investors both took profits on the meteoric gains and began the early rotation into non-tech names that has helped the  outpace both the  and the  over the past four weeks.

content.title: Oracle Stock Set to Drop for Fourth Day. How Its OpenAI Bet Went Wrong for the Shares.
content.summary: Oracle  stock has given back all the gains from the cloud computing group’s “  Nvidia  Moment” as investors grow increasingly cautious over investments linked to the artificial intelligence boom.  The selloff is due, in part, to the stock having risen so sharply over the month that followed its update, as news investors both took profits on the meteoric gains and began the early rotation into non-tech names that has helped the  outpace both the  and the  over the past four weeks.

headline: Don’t Call Them Bets. They’re ‘Prediction Markets’—and Robinhood Is Getting Rich Off Them.
summary: “Will the U.S. say that aliens exist this year?”  Robinhood Markets  clients can currently guess “yes” through their brokerage app, paying $4, plus $2 in fees, to win $100 if they’re right.  If I’ve been abducted and probed by extraterrestrials, is it inside information?  Robinhood  prefers terms like “prediction markets” and “event trading.”
